config_description: Replica factor is explicitly set, regardless of keyspace or datacenter. This is the replica factor within the datacenter, like NTS.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'allocate_tokens_for_local_replication_factor' in the code is used to determine how tokens are allocated for local replication factor. It checks if initial tokens are specified, if allocation keyspace is specified, or if a local replication factor is specified. Based on these conditions, it either uses the specified tokens, allocates tokens based on keyspace or local replication factor, or generates random tokens.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the 'allocate_tokens_for_local_replication_factor' configuration in the system depends on when new nodes are bootstrapped or when token allocation needs to be updated. This configuration is triggered during the bootstrap process or when token allocation needs to be adjusted.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'allocate_tokens_for_local_replication_factor' configuration option on the system is significant as it determines how tokens are allocated for local replication factor. It affects the distribution of data across nodes and can impact the performance and reliability of the system based on the chosen token allocation strategy.
